subject: Re: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: ... My *guess* would be that this allows them to be used without having to inherit from, or have to hand an instance of, Assert. Like, you want to put a
messageBody:
On Thursday 17 February 2005 15:18, Mike Clark wrote:
> I like how you think, Todd. :-)
>
> I don't know the history behind the design decision to use static
> methods in Assert, but I'd love to know.

My *guess* would be that this allows them to be used without
having to inherit from, or have to hand an instance of,
Assert.

Like, you want to put a JUnit-style assertion in a piece of code
that already exists.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
